TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LoginStatusDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the Web server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control renders a button that automatically checks the authentication status of the user and displays the appropriate login or logout option.
In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> to generate the design-time markup, since the user authentication status is not available at design time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> at design time. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus>.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner> class to change the appearance of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyLoginStatus` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus>. The `MyLoginStatus` is a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control. The example also derives the `MyLoginStatusDesigner` class from <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner>, and then applies a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> attribute for the `MyLoginStatusDesigner` on the `MyLoginStatus` control.
The `MyLoginStatusDesigner` overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to draw a blue, dashed border around the control to make it more visible, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the `MyLoginStatus` is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.NotSet> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.None> value.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner/CS/LoginStatusDesigner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner/VB/LoginStatusDesigner.vb#1)]

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ActionLists As DesignerActionListCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property creates a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner> class, adds it to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> that is obtained from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.ActionLists%2A> base property, and then returns the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetDesignTimeHtml () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
Docs.returns: A string containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LogoutText%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LoginText%2A> property (depending on whether the user is logged in), is `null`, an empty string (""), or a single space (" "), the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LogoutText%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LoginText%2A> property, as appropriate, to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property, enclosed in brackets ("[ ]"). Then, regardless of the setting of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LoginText%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus.LogoutText%2A>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> base method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner> class to change the appearance of a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> class at design time. The example draws a blue, dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the control is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.NotSet> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle.None> value.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner/CS/LoginStatusDesigner.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner/VB/LoginStatusDesigner.vb#2)]

block.para: If you override the method, be sure to call the base method because it eventually, through several override levels, calls on the control or a copy of the control to generate the markup.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub Initialize (component As IComponent)

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The visual designer calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.Initialize%2A> method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.Initialize%2A> and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property UsePreviewControl As Boolean
protected: virtual property bool UsePreviewControl { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is always `true`, the designer <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property returns a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property creates the copy by persisting the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> control, then parsing the persisted control string. The copied control does not affect any persistence for the actual <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus>.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LoginStatusDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginStatus> itself to generate the design-time markup, and design-time changes to the control will persist to the page markup source.

block.para: You can override the property to return or to determine its value based on whether the control is marked with a class level attribute. If the is not overridden, the ignores the .
